School Management (PyQt5)

qt_app module

School Management (PyQt5) application.

This module provides the PyQt5 GUI for managing students, instructors, and courses. It exposes a MainWindow with three tabs: - Students: add/update/delete students and view their registered courses - Instructors: add/update/delete instructors and view their assigned courses - Courses: add/clear, assign instructor, and register students

It also includes utilities for saving/loading JSON snapshots and backing up the database.

The code is documented with Sphinx-style docstrings so it can be included in a full project documentation site using Sphinx autodoc.

Usage (CLI):

python qt_app.py

Typical build integration:

  • Keep application launch under if __name__ == "__main__": so Sphinx can import the module without executing the GUI.

JSON_PATH = 'school.json'

Default JSON path for save/load operations

STUDENTS = []

In-memory cache of students (populated by MainWindow.reload_all())

INSTRUCTORS = []

In-memory cache of instructors (populated by MainWindow.reload_all())

COURSES = []

In-memory cache of courses (populated by MainWindow.reload_all())

text(item)[source]

Get the text of a QTableWidgetItem safely.

Parameters:

item (QTableWidgetItem or None) – The table item (may be None).

Returns:

The item’s text, or an empty string if item is None.

Return type:

str

class MainWindow(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: QMainWindow

Main window for the School Management PyQt5 application.

Provides tabs for Students, Instructors, and Courses; supports saving/loading data to/from JSON, and creating DB backups.

Variables:

  • tbl_students (QTableWidget) – Table showing student records with their registered courses

  • tbl_instructors (QTableWidget) – Table showing instructor records with their assigned courses

  • tbl_courses (QTableWidget) – Table showing course records with instructor and enrolled students

make_students_tab()[source]

Build and return the Students tab UI.

Includes a form (ID, Name, Age, Email), Add/Update/Clear actions, and a table with Edit/Delete actions.

Returns:

The tab widget for Students management.

Return type:

QWidget

clear_student_form()[source]

Clear all student form fields and focus the ID field.

add_student()[source]

Validate inputs and add a new student to the database.

Raises:

ValueError – If ID missing, age negative, or email invalid.

Side effects:

  • Calls models.db.add_student()

  • Refreshes UI via reload_all()

  • Clears form via clear_student_form()

update_student()[source]

Validate inputs and update an existing student in the database.

Raises:

ValueError – If ID missing, age negative, or email invalid.

Side effects:

  • Calls models.db.update_student()

  • Refreshes UI via reload_all()

  • Clears form via clear_student_form()

fill_student_form_from_row()[source]

Load the currently selected student row from the table into the form.

No-op if no row is selected.

  • Refreshes UI via reload_all()

  • Clears form via clear_instructor_form()

No-op if no row is selected.

make_courses_tab()[source]

Build and return the Courses tab UI.

Includes:

  • Add Course (ID + Name)

  • Assign Instructor (by ID)

  • Register Student (by ID)

  • Courses table with Edit/Delete actions

Returns:

The tab widget for Courses management.

Return type:

QWidget

clear_course_form()[source]

Clear the course form fields and focus the Course ID field.

add_course()[source]

Add a new course to the database.

Raises:

RuntimeError – Surfaces DB-layer errors (e.g., duplicates).

Side effects:

  • Calls models.db.add_course()

  • Refreshes UI via reload_all()

  • Clears form via clear_course_form()

assign_instructor()[source]

Assign the selected instructor to the selected course.

Raises:

RuntimeError – Surfaces DB-layer errors.

Side effects:

  • Calls models.db.assign_instructor()

  • Refreshes UI via reload_all()

register_student()[source]

Register the selected student to the selected course.

Raises:

RuntimeError – Surfaces DB-layer errors.

Side effects:

  • Calls models.db.register_student()

  • Refreshes UI via reload_all()

fill_course_form_from_row()[source]

Load the currently selected course row into the form fields and set the course pickers to that course.

No-op if no row is selected.

delete_selected(kind)[source]

Delete the currently selected row of the given kind.

Parameters:

kind (str) – One of "student", "instructor", or "course".

Side effects:

  • Calls the appropriate DB delete function

  • Refreshes UI via reload_all()

reload_all()[source]

Reload in-memory lists from the database and refresh UI.

Side effects:

  • Updates global STUDENTS, INSTRUCTORS, COURSES

  • Calls fill_tables() and fill_pickers()

fill_tables()[source]

Repopulate the three tables (students, instructors, courses) from the global in-memory caches.

fill_pickers()[source]

Repopulate combo boxes used for registrations and assignments so users can only pick valid IDs.

save_json()[source]

Save the current in-memory data to a JSON file at JSON_PATH.

Side effects:

Calls models.data_manager.DataManager.save_to_file() and shows a message box on success/failure.

load_json()[source]

Load a JSON snapshot from JSON_PATH, rebuild in-memory objects, overwrite the database accordingly, and refresh the UI.

Side effects:

  • Calls load_into_memory()

  • Calls overwrite_db_from_memory()

  • Calls reload_all()

backup_db()[source]

Create a database backup using models.db.backup_db() and display the path.

load_into_memory(data)[source]

Convert a JSON-like structure into in-memory objects and link relationships.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Parsed JSON dict containing students, instructors, courses.

Side effects:

  • Rebuilds global STUDENTS, INSTRUCTORS, COURSES lists

  • Recreates object relationships (assigned/registered entities)

overwrite_db_from_memory()[source]

Rewrite the database from the current in-memory objects.

Steps:

  1. Clear all DB tables.

  2. Insert instructors and their assigned courses.

  3. Insert courses and link their instructor IDs.

  4. Insert students and their registrations.

Side effects:

Mutates the DB and repopulates rows consistently with memory.

main()[source]

Application entry point.

Ensures DB tables exist, creates a MainWindow, shows it, and starts the Qt event loop.

Returns:

Process exit code from the Qt app exec loop.

Return type:

int
